unnormalised: Hey folks, ever wondered where all that shaadi ka leftover biryani ends up? Well, let's talk waste management!
normalised: Hey folks, ever wondered where all that shaadi ka leftover biryani ends up? Well, let's talk waste management!

unnormalised: In environmental news, things are slowly but surely changing. The IIT-Delhi recently announced a breakthrough in converting plastic waste into usable fuel, a game-changer for our overflowing landfills, especially those around Delhi's borders. Imagine, turning all those Lays packets into something useful!
normalised: In environmental news, things are slowly but surely changing. The I I T-Delhi recently announced a breakthrough in converting plastic waste into usable fuel, a game-changer for our overflowing landfills, especially those around Delhi's borders. Imagine, turning all those Lays packets into something useful!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, down south in Chennai, the local corporation is experimenting with a new composting method using enzymes inspired by traditional Ayurvedic practices. They claim it drastically reduces composting time.
normalised: Meanwhile, down south in Chennai, the local corporation is experimenting with a new composting method using enzymes inspired by traditional Ayurvedic practices. They claim it drastically reduces composting time.

unnormalised: Remember that scene in 'Dil Dhadakne Do' where they're sailing through incredibly polluted waters? Well, that's a stark reminder of why we need better systems. Many smaller towns are still struggling with waste segregation, and a lot ends up just being burned, creating air pollution worse than a Diwali night.
normalised: Remember that scene in 'Dil Dhadakne Do' where they're sailing through incredibly polluted waters? Well, that's a stark reminder of why we need better systems. Many smaller towns are still struggling with waste segregation, and a lot ends up just being burned, creating air pollution worse than a Diwali night.

unnormalised: Experts say citizen participation is key. Small changes, like composting kitchen waste at home or using reusable bags, can make a big difference. Every little bit helps in this Swachh Bharat mission! Let's get our act together, India!
normalised: Experts say citizen participation is key. Small changes, like composting kitchen waste at home or using reusable bags, can make a big difference. Every little bit helps in this Swachh Bharat mission! Let's get our act together, India!
